climbs.name: Plant Based Diet
climbs.fa: Most likely.. Gokul Gopal Oct 2019 Ground up - On-sight. Doug Hemken and Burt Lindquist too.

content.description: Broken corner and crack system that runs up the middle of Picnic Wall Right side.  Pretty much even grade all the way up.  Lots of loose rock and vegetation...
content.protection: Normal Trad gear rack with all sizes.  Brings many runners.
content.location: Broken corner and crack system that runs up the middle of Picnic Wall Right side.  Pretty much even grade all the way up.  Lots of loose rock and vegetation...There is a large deciduous tree found just right of the base of this route.

content.description: Start to the right of the overhang, follow the fracture up to a rest ledge with wavy rock. Move left and up through the overhang. Definitive crux moving through the overhang before getting to a small in-cut crimp, heel hook and jug haul to the finish.
content.location: Starts to the right of the over hang. The rock is wavy from ancient water.

content.description: This route is in the middle of Picnic Area Right. It follows a left facing corner about 15ft then switches to a right facing corner and eases up to the top of the cliff.

climbs.name: I Lost My Sole in the UP
climbs.fa: Eric Landmann, Kamila Fassbender, Burt Lindquist, March 2019

content.description: On the right part of the wall, start left of a rock rib. Go up 2 moves to a short leftward traverse to a convenient tree stance. Next up to the ledge, move left to a shallow blocky groove. Top out on a large ledge. You can rappel from a huge pine tree 30 feet to the left. Gear is there but not very obvious. This is a pure gear route. FA was done in proper style, ground-up, on-site.
content.protection: Mostly small to medium cams, a couple of medium nuts, there are no bolts on this route.
content.location: Far right side of Picnic Wall, to the left of a blocky area near the right end of the wall.

climbs.name: Happy With Me
climbs.fa: Lead after TR inspect .  Burt Lindquist Eric Landmann and Kamila Fassbender.  Mar/Oct 2019

content.description: Sustained climbing on square cuts and horizontals with maybe hardest moves at top.
content.protection: TR anchor at top with long slings.  Trad gear for lead is from Yellow BD C4 down to small wires.
content.location: This route climbs the face just right of the route Diagonal Dish.  There is small birch tree just left of the start and a large pine tree to the right and above about 15ft. The first 30ft climb steep but nice rock with many nice positive holds to found at various angles and locations.   There is a moderate sized ledge at about 30 ft mark where there is a large flake/block.  Climb rightwards above the block along nicely broken rock and a faint fissure to the top, where the moves are the steepest  and the holds get smaller.  There is a separate direct finish that takes thin crack straight up from the flake and clocks in at 5.9+.  No anchor to be found at top and a TR anchor must be built with long slings from trees and small cracks in wall behind top ledge.

climbs.name: Ferrous Bueller's Day Off
climbs.fa: Maybe.. TR only so far, Burt Lindquist, Doug Hemken, and Gokul Gopal

content.description: This climb takes the steep but broken wall to the right of the route "Jason's Folly".  First 50 feet is steep rock climbing with small side pulls and horizontals pulling onto one ledge at 20 feet and then second ledge at 40 feet.  From second ledge climb easier broken rock up under a very small overhang/horizontal.... then climb the hanging left slanting hand crack to the top.  The top out moves are strenuous.. Clocks in at solid 5.9.
content.protection: TR only so far but upper hanging hand crack would easily take cams.  TR anchor was achieved with long slings from trees at the top.
content.location: This climb takes the steep but broken wall to the right of the route "Jason's Folly".  There is an obvious treed up ledge at just over half height.  There is a corner crack that goes up from the left side of this treed ledge that is a separate climb.

content.description: This is a diagonal crack leaning to the right.  The climb is broken mid way by a ledge and has a large pin tree to climbers right on the top.

Picnic Wall Right Side is the first wall you see from walking east to west past the Drytool wall.  It is just as high as Picnic Wall Left, but the rock is more broken, and slightly less appealing as a destination.
